timeline.message: Consider field readonly-ness in is type check - phase I
Fix subtyping for objects with module-level visibility fields
Refactor code and use unresolved types for object field is type check

timeline.bodyText: I think HashSet is a better choice if we are searching in the unresolvedTypes.
timeline.author: KRVPerera

replies.bodyText: This is passed on to checkIsType and in general we seem to be using lists in checkIsType and checkIsLikeType. Shall we do this change separately? Can you please create an issue with the suggestion?
replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyText: What's the reason to call checkIslikeType() for readonly fields and checkIsType() for non-readonly fields?
timeline.author: pubudu91

replies.bodyText:
A readonly field cannot be updated, and whatever the value that was initially set is guaranteed to be immutable.
For an immutable value, is type is the same as is like type (as though the "inherent type" changed).
So if there is a readonly field, we know that it can never change (the reference or the value). So if the value specified for that field looks like the target type it would mean that it belongs to the target type.
This is similar to how we call check-is-like-type when check-is-type is used with immutable values.
replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.bodyText: We should consider the org name too right? Not sure whether the version should be considered though
timeline.author: pubudu91

replies.bodyText:
We should consider all 3 right? Two different versions of the same module can be considered as two different modules IMO, when considering visibility regions.
Will fix, thanks.
replies.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: Came across #25199 when trying to fix this. Both fixed in 8d23769.
